issue.title: [CF 212] Tellmewhen completely absent
issue.body:
Tellmewhen doesn't show itself anymore since the most recent update. (Though it might also include the update before that, which I skipped). I've de- and reinstalled Tmw entirely but not even the menu will show after I type /tmw, though I still seem to have retained my saved variables. I also got this error, perhaps they're related:

ORIGINAL ERROR (BELOW) NO LONGER AN ISSUE (FIXED IN 4.2.1.2) - Cyb

Date: 2011-05-28 13:50:36
ID: 2
Error occured in: Global
Count: 1
Message: ..\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Types\meta.lua line 80:
   bad argument #1 to 'tinsert' (table expected, got nil)

comments.body:
Also got this:

Date: 2011-05-28 13:59:13 ID: 3 Error occured in: Global Count: 1 Message: ..\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua line 2059: attempt to perform arithmetic on local 'start' (a nil value) Debug: [C]: ? TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:2059: SetInfo() TellMeWhen\Types\meta.lua:63: OnUpdate() TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:885: TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:868


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

Long story: I was first experiencing issues with 4.2.1.2, then after downgrading to 4.2.1.1 the addon became functional again. I then upgraded back up to 4.2.1.2, the addon continued to function properly. Today I upgraded to r98 and Tmw was gone again, so now I'm playing with 4.2.1.2.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

What do you mean when you say that it is "gone"?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

No icons are displayed and the /tmw command solicits no reaction. However if I press escape, klick Interface and navigate to Addons->Tellmewhen I can still edit groupsettings and confirm the addon is evidently running and still has its saved variables.

Also after playing for a while with 4.2.1.2 I've also experienced the scenario where TellMeWhen was running for the most part, except for maybe one group, which would oddly begin functioning after calling /tmw once and dismissing it again.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

Could you attach your saved variables file?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I got the same problem. I updated TMW today and it won't work now. No groups are displayed '/tmw' does nothing. When I open the options menu (Interface->AddOns->TellMeWhen) i get this error:

Message: Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Types\buff.lua:87: attempt to perform arithmetic on upvalue 'UPD_INTV' (a nil value) Time: 05/29/11 22:57:30 Count: 1 Stack: (tail call): ? Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Types\buff.lua:87: in function `OnUpdate' Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Types\buff.lua:227: in function `Setup' Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:2603: in function `Icon_Update' Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:1897: in function `Group_Update' ...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen_Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:670: in function <...ace\AddOns\TellMeWhen_Options\TellMeWhen_Options.lua:667> (tail call): ? [C]: ? [string "safecall Dispatcher[2]"]:9: in function <[string "safecall Dispatcher[2]"]:5> (tail call): ? ...nfig-3.0\AceConfigDialog-3.0\AceConfigDialog-3.0.lua:798: in function <...nfig-3.0\AceConfigDialog-3.0\AceConfigDialog-3.0.lua:613> (tail call): ? [C]: ? [string "safecall Dispatcher[3]"]:9: in function <[string "safecall Dispatcher[3]"]:5> (tail call): ? Interface\AddOns\Ace3\AceGUI-3.0\AceGUI-3.0.lua:314: in function `Fire' ...ns\Ace3\AceGUI-3.0\widgets\AceGUIWidget-CheckBox.lua:68: in function <...ns\Ace3\AceGUI-3.0\widgets\AceGUIWidget-CheckBox.lua:57>

Locals: <none>

Edited May 29, 2011

> Posted by CurseForge user Todesbote

Here you go. Though Tmw is largely running smoothly now. Present issues are one error as soon as I target an enemy (the one posted below) aswell as Tmw not responding to /tmw until I enter the command for at least the third time. Also with my druid group 4 isn't immediately showing after launch though it should, only after opening and dismissing tmw does it begin functioning properly.

PS: The above observations were made for r99

Edited May 30, 2011

> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

What talent spec/profile is this occuring in?

Edited May 30, 2011

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Yay! Error reproduced!
Occurs when targeting a hostile unit that is in close range while in talent spec 2(feral) in the Qwop - Resto profile.
Cause: Condition icons do not define icon.__start/ icon.__duration

Edited May 30, 2011

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Still unable to reproduce the problem where the slash command doesn't work the first time. Try r100 and see if that fixed it.

Also note that I was never able to reproduce the problem with group 4 not appearing. It appears as soon as I target something hostile while I am in my secondary spec, as the conditions indicate that it should.

Edited May 30, 2011

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

None of the previously listed issues have reappeared since I've updated to r101, though I'm still keeping an eye out. In the meanwhile I've encountered the following defect playing arenas recently: The cooldown timer on barkskin (group 7, icon 2, qwop - resto profile) will often not display. I'm not sure yet, this could also extend to other icons aswell. I also don't know how to reliably reproduce the error. It's just something I've noticed during matches every now and then.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

This is a longstanding error with the cooldown animations on Blizzard's side. Occasionally, even if their frame level is explicitly set to be on top of the icon texture by TMW, they will sometimes go underneath. OmniCC's text will still appear, but the cooldown animation will not. Ive tried to fix this in about a dozen different ways, but it still seems to slip through sometimes. You should be able to fix it by toggling config on and off (/tmw).


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
